poem:
Title: The Uncertain Distance

A pensive man, now distant, 
holding mysteries within his gaze,
Frustration stirs, love's constant haze.

Five years of withered intimacy,
questions bloom, love's subtle dance.
His silence, casting doubts afoul - 
A silent, seething, secret glance.

Oh speak, the heart pleads,
Unravel this thread, so tightly spun.
Find the words, love's language lost,
In the quiet of doubts begun.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My boyfriend’s behaviour is making me second-guess everything. What should I do? | Leading questions My boyfriend and I have been together for five years now, and for the most part, things have been really good. But lately, I’ve been noticing some stuff that’s got me really confused and frustrated. First of all, he’s been really distant, like he’s always got something on his mind but won’t tell me. And when I try to talk". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
